p.s: The article Hope of escape lost in translation is a text which was written by Zia Haider Rahman and published by The Sunday Times on the 17th December 2016.
It'sIts target group is everyone who is interested and it was published with the intention to warn about the risks of not knowing your country's language.
The text can be devideddivided into four paragraphs.
In lines one to four, the author informs about the huge amount of money that is spent on translating and interpreting for immigrants who live in Great Britain.
After that, he states that the people of Britain send confusing signals, convincing immigrants who don't speak English that they don't have to learn the language or integrate at all.
In the second paragraph (ll. 5-10), the author shows examples of failed integration and it'sits dangers.
According to him, quarters in which solely immigrant communities live are more likely to have high criminality rates and a low educational standard.
Furthermore, you can learn English quickly in the right environment and if you try hard enough.
This is stated in the third paragraph (ll. 11-17).
In the last paragraph, the author concludes the article by speaking his mind on the topic celebrating diversity, which in his opinion reinforces the idea that integration is not necessary.
His final statement is that learning English should be mandatory if you live in Britain.
